text: Jones–Lee House is a historic home located at Greenville, Pitt County, North Carolina. It was built in 1895, and is a two-story, "L"-plan, frame dwelling with Queen Anne style decorative elements. It has an intersecting gable roof and one-story, gable roofed porch. It features decorative shingles, curvilinear sawnwork, and applied half-timbering. It was added to the National Register of Historic Places in 1980. ==References== Category:Houses on the National Register of Historic Places in North Carolina Category:Queen Anne architecture in North Carolina Category:Houses completed in 1895 Category:Houses in Pitt County, North Carolina Category:National Register of Historic Places in Greenville, North Carolina
title: Jones–Lee House
